places.name: Merlion
places.description: The Merlion is the national personification of Singapore. Its name combines "mer" meaning the sea and "lion".

places.name: Asian Civilisations Museum
places.description: The Asian Civilisations Museum is an institution which forms a part of the four museums in Singapore, the other three being the Peranakan Museum at Old Tao Nan School, the National Museum of Singapore and the Singapore Art Museum.

places.name: Clarke Quay
places.description: Clarke Quay is a historical riverside quay in Singapore, located within the Singapore River Planning Area.

places.name: Fort Canning Park
places.description: Fort Canning Hill, formerly Government Hill, Singapore Hill and Bukit Larangan, or simply known as Fort Canning, is a prominent hill, about 48 metres high, in the southeast portion of Singapore, within the Central Area that forms Singapore's central business district.

places.name: Orchard Road
places.description: Orchard Road is Singaporeâ€™s retail heart, with discount outlets, department stores and upscale boutiques, alongside luxury hotels.
